Plot TeX at a position.

Source: R/plot.R
plotTeX3D.Rd

Plot TeX at a position.

plotTeX3D(
  x,
  y,
  z,
  tex,
  cex = graphics::par("cex"),
  fixedSize = FALSE,
  size = 480,
  ...
)

Arguments

x

Coordinate.
y

Coordinate.
z

Coordinate.
tex

TeX string.
cex

Expansion factor (you properly have to fine tune it).
fixedSize

Fix the size of the object (no scaling when zoom).
size

Size of the generated png.
...

Arguments passed on to sprites3d.

Value

The shape ID of the displayed object is returned.

Examples

tex0 <- "$\\mathbb{R}_{\\geqq}$"
tex1 <- "\\LaTeX"
tex2 <- "This is a title"
ini3D(argsPlot3d = list(xlim = c(0, 2), ylim = c(0, 2), zlim = c(0, 2)))
plotTeX3D(0.75,0.75,0.75, tex0)

#> Warning: error in running command
#> Error in normalizePath(pdf, mustWork = TRUE): path[1]="/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpKiC6JH/fileaa361f9def1.pdf": No such file or directory
plotTeX3D(0.5,0.5,0.5, tex0, cex = 2)

#> Warning: error in running command
#> Error in normalizePath(pdf, mustWork = TRUE): path[1]="/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpKiC6JH/fileaa35b9bd277.pdf": No such file or directory
plotTeX3D(1,1,1, tex2)

#> Warning: error in running command

finalize3D()
ini3D(new = TRUE, argsPlot3d = list(xlim = c(0, 200), ylim = c(0, 200), zlim = c(0, 200)))
plotTeX3D(75,75,75, tex0)
